storyInfo: Finally arriving at the part of the story where the prison break plan is explained in detail, Silence explains how the jailbreak went, step by step.

attributes.content: I can see how someone who's never known life outside the prison would be scared of the world.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Well, thankfully, I know how it all turned out in the end. She left with them. If I didn't know that, this is about where I'd start getting all anxious.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Isn't that great~?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: So after that was when they started preparing for the jailbreak, right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It should've been about a month and a half after Kafka was put in prison when Anthony made the decision to get out. Then, it took them about another month to come up with a concrete plan to get out of there.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Which means there was about a month and a half from the time they finished their plan till the actual jailbreak, right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It was four months altogether. It's not that long, but it's not that short either.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But I guess we're finally at the part I'm interested in the most.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: ...What's this diagram?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Oh, I know. this is the prison's layout, right?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: That's right~ It's kinda crude, but it's got everything you need to know on there.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The part that I'm the most curious about is how they got out.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Of course, I'm interested in the story behind the team, but this is a prison break! That's the part that keeps us all on the edge of our seats~!
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You told me you wanted to understand the whole process. Is that really just because you're interested in the jailbreak?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Sure, you can think of it like that.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: If we're going to talk about it, we might as well start from the beginning.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: First, let's take a look at the prison's design. The architects clearly learned from their experience with the nomadic cities. The prison wasn't built directly on top of the chassis.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: They built a mountain base first, like what you'd find in the real world, and then they finished the prison design on top of that.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: This is a pretty common technique these days, but, back in the day, it was ahead of its time, and it was very successful.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Now, let's set aside the prison's outside appearance for the time being.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The prison has three floors, and each floor's structure is more or less the same.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: At the lower-left of each floor is the A-Zone. This is where the non-Infected are kept.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: To the upper-right is the B-Zone, the Infected block.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The upper-left and lower-right corners are where the guardhouses are. That's where the jailers usually stay.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The black monolith in the center is the C-Zone, where the most serious felons are kept.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The area in the middle here is the underground factory. This is where the prisoners work together.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Over here is the clinic. It's also Domma's room. Next to that is the morgue.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: On the other side is the library that they built at Anthony's suggestion.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That's more or less the prison's layout.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Mina spent a bit of time exploring, and with the basic idea figured out, they came up with a way to escape from the prison.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: You can tell by looking at the layout that the C-Zone tower isn't actually built directly onto the ground.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: There is an elevator in the middle that goes to the basement. Not only that, but the tower itself can actually be lowered underground.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Ohhh? No kidding?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Yeah, these kinds of structures aren't very common. They probably designed it that way so that they can keep the inmates underground during emergencies, where they can't cause trouble.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Right, and to lower the tower, you normally need to flip the switches in two of the guardhouses at the same time.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Oh, I get it.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: The info I got after the fact did mention that the tower sank all the way to the bottom, so they probably activated the mechanism at the guardhouses, right...? Huh? Wait a minute... That doesn't make sense.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Even if they made it underground, was there a way out down there?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: First off, they didn't go to the guardhouses. They thought about it at one point.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: However, they found out the mechanisms could only lower the tower very slowly.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Anthony figured that out from a document he found in the library.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The document was probably a design diagram left behind after the prison's construction. My assumption is no one thought about it, so they stuck it in there when Anthony suggested building a library.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: They probably figured no one would ever need that for anything. After all, the prison was built more than twenty years ago.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: It was twenty-five years ago.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: In any case, they couldn't just wait for the tower to slowly sink to the bottom. The guards would have tried to do something, and so they abandoned this idea altogether.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Huh? But in that case...
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Fortunately, they found something else on the document—
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Take a look at the top of the central tower. There's a room here, and it isn't a prison cell.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That's the real control room of the tower, if not the whole prison.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The control room... I see. That's where you can make the tower drop all the way to the bottom, right?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: That's right, and it's also possible to cut off the prison's electricity there to cause a commotion, however brief.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: There usually isn't anyone on that floor. You need a special elevator key to get inside. The regular keycards that the jailers carry can't access this floor.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I think I get it now. They went up to the control room, sank the tower all the way to the bottom, and cut the power off to cause a ruckus up above.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: But that still leaves us a question—
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: What happened after that.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Is there a way out underground?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: There is.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Domma provided that way out.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: She said that, going by her memory, the last morgue doctor had told her there weren't any previous designs the architects could reference when building the prison, and there were actually a few abandoned structures at the bottom of the mountain.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: And some of those led to the surface outside the prison.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: In particular, there was one fairly close to the morgue.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It's close, but there's also a wall that's three meters thick in-between.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So... did they dig their way through?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Yes, they dug through the wall.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The walls themselves are made of rebar and concrete, but it's just soil outside.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Once you find a weaker section of wall and breach it, you don't need any advanced tools to dig the tunnel.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That's what they did, they took turns digging at the clinic.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Huh? Now that you mention it, if they were going to dig a tunnel at the morgue, couldn't they have left as soon as the tunnel was done?
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Have you forgotten already? Getting to the surface outside the prison isn't going to do you much good when the prison isn't stopped at a city.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The prison also raises its security whenever it stops at a city. When that happens, the prisoners get much less free time.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Even Anthony hardly had any free time.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: They couldn't just have gone to the clinic like before.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Oh, right. Teehee, I forgot.
attributes.name: Muelsyse

attributes.content: Right, since the prison was stopped at a city, Mina left with the construction crew before the jailbreak, so she didn't actually participate in it.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: She rendezvoused with the gang outside the prison.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Anyway, at some point in the last month and a half, they stole the key that gave them access to the control room at the top of the tower from Chief Barton.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Then, a few days before the prison was slated to make its next port call, they finished digging the tunnel and made sure it led them to the surface.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Now all the preparations were finally complete.
attributes.name: Silence
